data.title: Something different
data.text: Nice hotel, interesting planning of the facility. Feelings almost like home. No regrets, clean, modern. Did not experienced the use of kitchen, but all equipment looked fine. Standard breakfast, but enough to start a day with full stomach. It could become boring in long term, due to the predictability of menu. Sleep quality great, except the close proximity of railway (I was awakened up couple times in night due to the train horn sounds). Staff professional and willing to provide service at their best. It is hard to evaluate location, because it is in industrial and business area, so for some guests it is 5 minutes, for others longer driving time. Traffic is OK, but could be experienced some delays on the end of day. 30-50 minutes drive from Detroit airport.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you loliksa, for taking the time to share your experience. We truly appreciate you taking the time out of your day.  We look forward to seeing you again when your travels bring you back to the area. Best Regards, Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing stay! Feeling at home!
data.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks for Bussiness purpose! Actually I felt like being at home, everything prepared for this! Amazing structure, rooms, breakfast and staff! Some days they offers a happy hours for the guests in the lobby! Really perfect! I highly recommend them!

data.title: Fire inspection
data.text: Great pepole and so nice rooms very clean and nice rooms love it ...free breakfast is good ..bathrooms are very clean and house keeping is great and very nice ........if u forget anything they give u it for free ...

data.title: Great staff!
data.text:
We stayed for a week in October while our house was having some renovations done. The staff was fantastic! Our daughter loved our housekeeper, and the food crew was great! The food was quite good for breakfast. There is a large selection and it rotates daily. 

We had a special request that the manager worked on for us, and then changed our minds so he even changed it back!  

Also, my wife left her favorite pillow, and they called the next day to say that they had retrieved it. 

Overall, a great stay!

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks, Donald B, for taking the time to review our location and share your experience. We appreciate it!  Next time you are having work to the house done or have family in from out of town, we hope you choose to stay with us again. Best regards, Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing stay
data.text: This is by far the best Residence Inn I have stayed at! Not very far from Ford feild and close to other attractions and resturants but not in a super busy area. Was a very quiet and peaceful stay. All the staff I encountered were friendly and welcoming. The rooms were clean and up to date, the balcony was a added bonus.The grounds were nicely kept. The young lady working the desk when we returned from the concert was kind enough to bring 2 pillows to the room that I had forgot to ask for. Even though we only stayed 1 night we did have some interaction with 2 of the housekeepers and they were both friendly and welcoming.I cant say enough good things about this place! My family and I are going to be returning to the area and plan on staying here again. I will definitely be recommending this hotle to all my friends and family.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Sara O!  Thank you for taking the time to review our location.  We are very happy that you had an enjoyable stay with us and look forward to seeing you again. Best Regards, Justin Morandini.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice new property but 1 bedroom is somewhat small for two on an extended stay
data.text: This place is really nice and new inside. An awkward set up for the elevator because of being on the top floor. The rooms are very fresh and appear to be in great shape, the carpet needs a good cleaning to remove spots but doesn't seem dirty. The pocket doors don't give much privacy from the sleeping area to the "living room" area but I'd imagine for a single person it would be fine. Clean and neat, so thats whats most important to us. We make the best of wherever we are, so this place works.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review our location.  We appreciate your feedback and will have our housekeeping department take extra time to locate any rooms with staining, so that we can get it taken care of right away. We hope that you have enjoyed your stay and you choose us to stay on your next visit to Warren.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.text: had a couple of ladies and it was nice and cozy with just a few ladies had the setting was perfect with the small group of friends we had food and some nice bottles of wine and the conversation was very nice and perfect and the room that I had got was great had a wonderful time and always enjoy visiting the residence Inn for any and every time I have had a gathering it has always been at the Residence or if it just to get a way from the hustle and bustle it a nice place just to relax

data.title: My birthday weekend
data.text: Love everything about my stay first we arrived an hour early and it was no problem the lady at the front desk was very professional but friendly got my room it was the right temperature and very clean the cleaning staff was very professional,and helpful I'm telling you everyday we left the hotel and came back with a clean room and if anyone knows me i always get hotel shoes the carpet was clean. This hotel has a lot of eating places around it when i was there the fair was in town. There's a lot of shopping area...but this is my second time in this hotel and i love everything about my stay and i will be back

data.title: A Pleasant Surprise
data.text: I had to book a last minute room on Priceline to attend a funeral. I booked an express deal and it was for the Residence Inn. Megan at the front desk was so helpful, and made great suggestions about local eateries, etc. The rooms were spacious and the decor was nice. My only complaint would be hair left in the shower, but I just collected it and threw it away. Breakfast every morning was great, fresh, and tasty. All of the staff were very nice and helpful.This was a great stay, and I would definitely stay again.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you mrslvp, for taking the time to review our location. We appreciate your time and hope to see you again soon under more pleasant circumstances. We will pass on the information you gave us to our housekeeping staff. Have a wonderful day, Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great staff!!
data.text:
The staff here from arrival to checkout was friendly and intent on making my stay a pleasant one.  Had 1 small issue with a TV in my room.  It was addressed as soon as practical.  The gentleman named Earnest who corrected the problem left a had written note apologizing for the inconvenience and assuring me the staff would be glad to help in any way possible.  The General Manager introduced himself and checked to ensure we were having a problem free and pleasant stay.  He "made the rounds" at breakfast each morning and introduced himself to everyone.  I've never seen that anywhere!  Not in any price range.  I will absolutely be back if I come back to Detroit for any reason.  Thank you for everything.

Marriott Corporate:  This would be an excellent training ground for your hotel staff.  Most especially for your new Managers.  Take note.  The customer service was exemplary and shows what Marriott service should be in every facility.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you Ronald R, for taking the time to share your experience.  We appreciate your feedback and look forward to you coming back and staying with us again. I am also very happy that our staff took care of you.  We all have Mr. Marriott's "Spirit To Serve" with every guest, every day for every stay. Best Regards, Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Travel further North, better Marriott hotels to be had elsewhere
data.text: Not what I expect from a Marriott.  Contacted front desk three times regarding poor tv reception - they didn't even have it entered to check service.  Overflowing trash cans in all public areas (for two days!).  Hard to get luggage through walk-way just to carry up the stairs to the rooms.  Service was lacking in customer appreciation.  Hotel guests were young kids there to party.  Won't return to this location.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review our location. I will look into the issues that you had and ensure that they were taken care of. We do have a no-party policy, and when issues are brought to our attention, we take care of it right away. We hope you give us a second chance while in the are again. 

Best regards, 

Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ready for an upgrade, or a tear down...
data.text: Truly mediocre in an impressively consistent way.   One doesn't expect much from a place like this, but often one is pleasantly surprised.  Not the case here - staff is nice but really not helpful.  Long and unexplained wait at check-in (at 4 pm, so it wasn't like we were early), not just for us and several other people; first room smelled of stale cigarette smoke, second one of old cat urine (but we stayed in it, because we'd spent 15 minutes on hold trying to reach the desk and then 10 minutes in line to change the room).  The building is hard to navigate, passageways to room literally involve twisting around narrow corners filled with giant and EXTREMELY LOUD air conditioning units, the room itself is well equipped but terribly laid out and very outdated.  Threadbare sheets - always a telltale sign.  It's family friendly which is fine, but soundproofing is bad so the perpetually barking dog in the room next door was a bit of a distraction.  Shower is not quite hot enough, which one could almost predict.  The breakfast itself is actually quite good, and the staff is nice - but like the rooms the breakfast layout is awful - almost like it was designed for bleary-eyed people to run into each other with plates full of food.  AND breakfast is only served until 9:30 on weekends...a little shoddy.   No 'do not disturb' sign, just 'no service today' - and even with that the housekeeping staff knocked loudly on the door at 9 am on a Sunday, then again at 9:15!   There are several other similar extended-stay hotels in the same complex, I'm sure all are better.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you AverillEwing, for taking the time to share your experience.  We truly appreciate all feedback given to us from our guests. We will take the time to share your experience with our staff and use the issues that you experienced as a teachable moment so that we can improve our service and standards. We hope that in the future you will give us another try and have a more enjoyable stay.

Best Regards, 

Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fabulous wedding weekend
data.text:
We opted to stay at this hotel as it was the one recommended by the newlyweds. They did well.

We were greeted by the staff in a very friendly manner. Indeed, whenever we saw a staff member, they promptly asked if they could help in any way.

The night of the wedding, we had to call the desk about the children running and screaming above our unit (we had to be up at 6 and we were approaching 1am). It was dealt with very promptly. 

Breakfast was good and plentiful, however, there is an odd traffic flow problem and it was quite crowded.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you Patswife2, for taking the time to share your experience. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and our staff was able to take care of you.  Hopefully we will have the pleasure of hosting you and your family again.

Best Regards, 

Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: If you're looking for a place to rest, this is not the place for you.
data.text: We have stayed at many Residence Inn's, and had a typical Marriott experience - clean room, quiet accommodations, good service, good breakfast.  Unfortunately, this Residence Inn failed to meet any of these expectations.  We weren't in our room five minutes when there was a knock on our door and a carpet cleaner was on the other side wanting to clean our carpets.  That would've been fine if we were just checking out, not checking in.  Our first night, we were awakened by the sound of a party in an adjacent room.  After calling the front desk several times, the police were called and removed the guests and their 10 friends.  This went on for 2 hours between 1 and 3am.  The next morning at breakfast, the General Manager came up and apologized for the inconvenience and stated he would credit my account all of the points used for that first night stay.  That would've been great if it had occurred.  Instead, my account was credit 1/3 of the points spent.  The breakfast also did not live up to my normal Marriott experience.  The sausage was clearly overcooked, and staff did not refill the fresh fruit upon request.  Our second night did not fare any better.  Again, we were awakened by partiers in an adjacent room.  This again went on for 2 hours and three calls to the front desk.  We finally fell asleep after 3:30 am.  When I spoke with Marriott in the morning, I was told the manager said nothing had happened that night.  I guess my wife and I imagined the noise and doors slamming shut at 2 am and 3 am.  Unless you have a white noise machine, I would NOT stay at this hotel.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear stpeterick, 

I am very sorry that you did not have an enjoyable stay with us while visiting the Warren area.  I have checked our account and only show that you were charged for the one night.  I will try to reach out to our rewards desk and ensure that the rest of your certificates get released. The issues that you experienced are not the normal practice at this hotel and we applogize that it affected your sleep.  We hope that the rest of your stay at the next property you choose was enjoyable. 

Best regards, 

Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Meh
data.text: Motel-style which I am not a fan of; seems like flies and beetles end up in the room as you come and go (the few i saw definitely traveled in with me, not like an overall issue with the place).  The staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is right next to the convention center so that is convenient if you are there for something.  I would stay again.  For the local market Im not sure how much better you can find without heading into Detroit

data.title: Convenient Hotel
data.text: This hotel is well located close to restaurants and shops. You do needs a car to get around. It has free parking and wifi. The breakfast stopped at 9:30am which is a bit early for a weekend stay.The room was a sweet with a separate bedroom, overall it is nice and clean but just a bit outdated.However it was convenient to just walk out the room as it was on the first floor. That weekend there was some loud teenagers around that were talking loud but it wasn't overwhelming. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Sofia L, for taking the time to share your thoughts about our property. We appreciate all your feedback and will share it with our management staff for consideration on extending the breakfast times. We hope to see you again soon. Best Regards, Justin Morandini
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice Extended Stay Place
data.text:
We moved here and the house was not ready. So stayed here for about a month.  They are pet friendly, but no matter how many times you call before hand and talk to them, they will forget about the pet you wrote on the internet website.  We were placed in an amazingly nice room.  I even told them at check in about my dog.  Well those nice rooms are not pet friendly -- totally makes sense because it was super nice.  

The pet friendly rooms -- ahh I see where the negative reviews come in now.  They are a bit run down.  Lots and lots of folks "live" here with their pets because of the house burned down or in between homes.  

Free hot breakfast every morning.  And every M,T, W they have some type of hot dinner or desert.  

They have an outdoor pool and basketball court.  They have bbq grills, picnic tables, and open green spaces to have parties (lots of family reunions were held there too).  

Folks are nice.  Cleaning crew in the pet-friendly rooms were not as good as the super nice rooms by the lobby.  

You can walk your dog in lots of safe places in the neighborhood nearby and the city hall grounds nearby.  The city hall has a water fountain splash park for kids.  On Saturdays, there is a farmer's market, all within a 5 minute walk.  

If you are staying for more than 8 days, their pet fee is cheaper than the other extended stay hotels in the area.  They have a one-time fee, compared to the other ones that are weekly.  

The only negative really did upset me.  I did not notice until I was doing my taxes months after I checked out:  the local phone calls are NOT free.  The sign said it was free.  I was charged over $25 for a few calls to my new workplace -- same area code, and making toll free phone calls to set up utilities for my home.    

Because of the décor of the pet rooms plus this little rip off on the phone, I downgraded my score.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Tarainjag, for taking the time to share your experience at our location, we appreciate it. As a pet friendly facility, we do welcome all pets, and for convenience, we do place guests with pets in a certain area.  The reason we have the specific area is for the pet walking area and we like to keep some room completely allergen free. After every pet is in house, we have a professional company come out and deep clean the carpets and furniture. Hopefully we will see you again or be able to host your guests when they come to visit you.  Best Regards, Justin Morandini.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Stay, Great Staff
data.text:
Came to Detroit in mid June to visit friends. My travelling companions and I were too busy to do much at the hotel other than sleep, bathe, and eat breakfast. We found the beds to be great. The showers were agreeable, unlike you sometimes find at other hotels where finding fine line between scalding and freezing is akin to cracking a safe. On the breakfast, we aren't a terribly picky bunch. I remember us particularly enjoying the eggs, the availability of milk cartons, and the availability of meat. Overall we had a wonderful time. 

Even after checkout, when I left a hat behind, the hotel staff was tremendously helpful. Not only did they locate the hat and mail it to me free of charge, then even opted for 2 day priority mail! This wasn't even them placating a rewards member or anything. We were normal people, even staying at a discounted rate. It definitely shows how much they care.

owner_response.author: RI_WARREN_GM, General Manager at Residence Inn Detroit Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Theo R, for taking the time to review our location.  We appreciate your kind words and are happy that you enjoyed your stay. Hopefully your travels will bring you back to the area again. Best wishes, Justin Morandini.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
